VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Barley relative to the peak of Oats in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Barley is to the {right} of the peak of Oats.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Oats show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Oats shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Corn} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =4486.4?
EVJ.A: At X =4486.4,the label with the highest density is {Rice}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 2292? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Barley}'s peak at {3989},{Soybeans}'s peak at {3764},{Rice}'s peak at {4129}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 3741? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Oats}'s peak at {566},{Corn}'s peak at {576},{Potatoes}'s peak at {541}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Potatoes or Rice?
NC.A: {Rice} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Potatoes or Soybeans?
NC.A: {Soybeans} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Corn}
